externalDocs.description: See documentation for Akamai's Access Revocation API

post.description: Add a new list to house token identifiers that you want revoked from access. You can have a total of 10 revocation lists. You can't modify these settings for a revocation list, so be sure you provide the proper details when adding one. However, you can [revoke](https://techdocs.akamai.com/adaptive-media-delivery/reference/post-revocation-list-ids) or [unrevoke](https://techdocs.akamai.com/adaptive-media-delivery/reference/unrevoke-revocation-list-ids) token identifiers from each revocation list, as necessary.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Access Revocation API

schema.description: Parameters assigned to a revocation list during its creation.

contractId.description: Include the Akamai-assigned contract ID for your instance of Access Revocation.

name.description: Set a friendly name for the revocation list. The name can only contain alphanumeric and dash characters.

202.description: The API accepted your request to create a revocation list.

schema.description: The API returns this response after it successfully creates a revocation list.

contractId.description: The Akamai-assigned contract ID for your instance of Access Revocation.

id.description: The unique numeric identifier that the API assigned to a revocation list.

name.description: A friendly name for the revocation list. The name can only contain alphanumeric and dash characters.

parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

get.description: List all of your revocation lists and view details about them.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Access Revocation API

200.description: The response provides the revocation lists.

schema.description: Use revocation lists to group token identifiers to block their use. Create a revocation list for an event to block specific tokens from accessing content.

items.description: Use a revocation list to group token identifiers to block their use. You could create a revocation list for a specific event to block specific tokens from accessing content.

contractId.description: The Akamai-assigned contract ID for your instance of Access Revocation.

createdBy.description: The Control Center login ID used to create the revocation list.

createdTime.description: The Unix epoch time that represents when you created the revocation list.

id.description: A unique numeric identifier assigned to a revocation list.

name.description: A friendly name for the revocation list. The name can only contain alphanumeric and dash characters.

get.description: List all of the identifiers for a specific revocation list to review their details.

schema.description: A list of all token authentication tokens, and the parameters set for each.

items.description: A list of all token authentication tokens, and the parameters set for each.

id.description: The unique identifier assigned to the token.

ttl.description: The time to live (TTL) set for tokens in the revocation list, in seconds. After this time elapses, Akamai removes this token from the revocation list.

parameters.name: revocationListId

post.description: Add a set of token identifiers to a revocation list to revoke them. Add up to 5,000 token identifiers in a single operation.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Access Revocation API

schema.description: The `session_id` set in the access token used with Token Authentication. The `session_id` serves as each token's `tokenId`.

items.description: The `session_id` set in the access token used with Token Authentication. The `session_id` serves as each token's `tokenId`.

durationSeconds.description: Akamai revokes the token for this number of seconds. After this time, Akamai marks it as unrevoked so requests can use it again. The minimum value is `1800`, or 30 minutes. If you set it to anything less, it resets to `1800`.

id.description: In the context of the Access Revocation API, this is your `tokenId`. When you set up the token, this is what you set for its `id` field.

200.description: The API added the tokens to the revocation list.

schema.description: The number of token identifiers in a revocation list and the maximum number it can house.

count.description: The number of token identifiers currently in the revocation list.

limit.description: The number of token identifiers you can still add to the revocation list.

405.description: [Unauthorized](https://techdocs.akamai.com/adaptive-media-delivery/reference/401). A value in your [authentication credential](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/set-up-authentication-credentials) is invalid or it has expired.

parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

parameters.description: Uniquely identifies each [revocation list](https://techdocs.akamai.com/adaptive-media-delivery/reference/get-revocation-lists). This corresponds to the revocation list object's `id` member.
parameters.name: revocationListId

get.description: Get a specific identifier that belongs to a revocation list and review its details.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Access Revocation API

200.description: The response provides the revocation list.

schema.description: Parameters set for a unique token authentication token.

id.description: The unique identifier assigned to the token.

ttl.description: The time to live (TTL) for the revocation list, in seconds. After this time elapses, Akamai removes this token from the revocation list.

401.description: [Unauthorized](https://techdocs.akamai.com/adaptive-media-delivery/reference/401). A value in your [authentication credential](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/set-up-authentication-credentials) is invalid or it has expired.

403.description: [Access forbidden](https://techdocs.akamai.com/adaptive-media-delivery/reference/403). You lack permission for this operation, such as having read-only access.

parameters.description: The token identifier portion of the complete Akamai token. A token identifier can contain a maximum of 64 alphanumeric characters, hyphens, or underscores.
parameters.name: tokenId

parameters.description: Uniquely identifies each [revocation list](https://techdocs.akamai.com/adaptive-media-delivery/reference/get-revocation-lists). This corresponds to the revocation list object's `id` member.
parameters.name: revocationListId

get.description: Get the current count and maximum number of identifiers allowed in the revocation list.
get.summary: Get revocation list identifier count information

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Access Revocation API

200.description: The response shows revocation list count information.

schema.description: The number of token identifiers in a revocation list and the maximum number it can house.

count.description: The number of token identifiers currently in the revocation list.

limit.description: The number of token identifiers you can still add to the revocation list.

get.description: Get Property Manager-specific information for AMD properties that use this revocation list.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Access Revocation API

200.description: The response provides the AMD properties that use the revocation list.

schema.description: Information for each AMD property that uses a revocation list.

items.description: File information for each AMD property that uses a revocation list.

arlFileId.description: The unique file identifier for the AMD property that's using access revocation.

propertyId.description: The unique property ID assigned to the AMD property.

propertyName.description: The property name set for the AMD property.
